This was my second pregnancy. The first was a miscarriage. Right from the beginning I was extremely worried and anxious because of the previous experience. There was also a pre-term risk in my pregnancy along with a cervical polyp which added to the complications. This time I did not wish to take any chances. It was good fortune that I got Dr. Harsha's reference through a close friend of mine. He had assured me that she was one of the best. And he was RIGHT!
From the first consult I was confident that we were in good hands. She is extremely meticulous about her approach. She reviews the complete case history on every visit so that there are no gaps. She reconfirms every single detail. She is also very particular about the tests and medicines and never prescribes anything that is not required. Her constant reassurance helped me to tackle stress and enjoy my pregnancy.
On the D day, she was available through the night coordinating with the on call doctors. She was there during the early morning hrs to deliver the baby. Once she was there the delivery was over in no time and I was able to hold my Angel. It was a Normal Vaginal Delivery.
I have no words to express my gratitude for her. The impression that she has left upon me is indelible. She is one of the most admired people not just as a doctor but as a person. Thank you Dr. Harsha, we love you!

One of the best decision I made was to consult dr. Harsha. I was initially taking treatment from other hospital bcos of some personal reasons switched my doctor. When I met dr. Harsha with my previous reports (6th month of pregnancy) she has gone through all the reports, explained the situation and asked to continue same tablets, encouraged me to have healthy diet and excersise. My second and third trimester journey was really smooth bcos of her advices. 
At the end of third trimester she explained clearly abt all the scenarios of delivery process. When I was in 39th weeks ,she said that baby weight is seems to be higher than normal range if we wait till natural labour pains then baby might gain more weight in that case labour process would be difficult. So she said will induce labour and try for normal delivery if not possible will go for C-section. 
On the of delivery she suggested me to get one more scan. By seeing those reports ( baby's weight and head circumference was large) she suggested and clearly explaind that NVT would be difficult if we proceed with that it may hurt baby, will go for C-section. My family also agreed for C-section bcoz baby was too large and we want our baby to be safe. Then finally we accepted for C-section but we wanted the operation on a particular time. Finalised time slot, on the day of operation she was exactly on time and operation also completed on scheduled time. We were blessed with a cute and healthy baby boy. 
We were very happy and very much satisfied with Dr's service. We always remember her and would defenatly recommend dr. Harsha to my friends and family members. 
Thank you soo much doctor.

Dr. Harsha was my consultant gynecologist for my 1st pregnancy from 5th month onwards. My initial  treatment started in home town because we were working from home during COVID. When my husband's office started and we came down to Bangalore, I was really concerned about changing doctor during my 5th month of pregnancy. I did all my research before meeting her and was too much worried about how will she react after knowing that I am changing doctor at this time. But there she was, too much calm and she went through all my previous reports one by one and made a note of all of it. She was very clear in her instructions. Also, the most important thing was she didn't change or added any of my medicines.

I know it's gonna be a long story here but after few more visits, I got infected with COVID. She used to respond to all my emails and gave proper instructions. Also, at around 7th month of my pregnancy, in my scan I was diagnosed with short cervix and I was having gestational diabetes as well. She gave clear instructions on what could happen and asked me to follow strict diet and complete bedrest. Also, I could deliver prematurely, so she gave medicines and injections accordingly so that I can deliver at the right time.

I followed complete bed rest, blood sugar monitoring and strict diet during pregnancy. And with her help, there came when I was into my 37th week and I went to her for 9th month check up. She examined me physically and said that I am already 2cm dilated. She asked me to get admitted on the same day as I was going to deliver today. I was really worried and was literally sweating. But she seemed excited of me delivering at the same day. At around 8 PM in evening, I got admitted to hospital and around 12 AM , I was fully dilated. I was not able to push for around 2 hrs, but there she was giving her clear instructions and she had to wait 2 hrs for me to push. She was still calm in her words and didn't shouted even once. She was always saying that you can do it. With all her help I could deliver normally at around 2 am in the morning. I am really blessed to be consulting with such a good doctor. As a human being also, she is  quite good. 
Again I am going to meet her tomorrow. I delivered my baby on 12 May 2022.
